page.title: 01ECOLOGY
page.content: {ECOLOGY}There is a marl pit in the area which is privately owned and has been turned into a conservation area by the owner. It has now been functiioning for three years. It is mixed deciduous woodland with a couple of christmas trees. The bird populatiion which nests there includes blackbird,thrush,great tit,blue tit, house sparrows, tree sparrows,spotted flycatcher,tree-creeper,nuthatch,chaff -inch,robin,wren and willow warbler. In winter wheatear,redwing and fieldfares also visit the area. The mammals found are hedgehog and grey squirrel. It is mainly a bird sanctuary as it is too dark for many species of wild flowers except bluebells and primroses. {Loynton Moss }is an area of Special Scientific interest famous for badgers,woodcock and wood butterflies.
